result.execSummary:
The defendant Kris M. MARCELLE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Tiffany Richter, 117 Parkway Street, Cleveland, WI  53015.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Attend batterer's treatment group and complete.

timeConds.notes:
Thirty (30) days, up front, under the Huber Law.   
Thirty (30) days, stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.   Transfer to Sheboygan County Jail is authorized.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kris M. MARCELLE

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which charges one count of misdemeanor battery-DVO, contrary to Section 940.19(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
Sentencing is set for 06-23-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 06-02-15 @ 9:00 a.m. BR-2.

It is hereby ordered that Kris Marcelle is allowed to have non-assaultive contact with Tiffany Richter and is allowed to have contact with her residence.
Copy delivered to jail.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for  03-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Tiffany Richter.  Bail furnished.
